greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of colored integer partitions of n using all colors of a k-set such that each block of part i with multiplicity j has a pattern of i*j distinct colors in increasing order; triangle T(n,k), k>=0, k<=n<=A024916(k), read by columns.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for all n>=0 and k>=0.  The triangle displays only positive terms.  All other terms are zero.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Columns k = 0..40, flattened
maple: g:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n=0, 0, numtheory[sigma](n)+g(n-1)) end:
b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0, add((t->
b(n-t, min(n-t, i-1), k)*binomial(k, t))(i*j), j=0..n/i)))
T:= (n, k)-> add(b(n$2, k-i)*(-1)^i*binomial(k, i), i=0..k):
mathematica: g[n_] := g[n] = If[n == 0, 0, DivisorSigma[1, n] + g[n - 1]] ;
b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[With[{t = i j}, b[n - t, Min[n - t, i - 1], k]*Binomial[k, t]], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
T[n_, k_] := Sum[b[n, n, k - i]*(-1)^i*Binomial[k, i], {i, 0, k}];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {n, k, g[k]}], {k, 0, 6}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 12 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Cf. A000203, A024916, A326616 (this triangle read by rows), A326649, A326651.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 12 2019
